flawed_nl_solution:
Book 1 was $12.50 and book 2 was $15.00 so 13 +15 = $28
He was buying 4 books, so these 2 were 25% off so 28 * 0.25 = $7
These two books came out to 28-7 = $<<28-7=21>>21
Books 3 & 4 were both $10 each so 2*10 = $20
When you add all 4 books together, 21+20 = $<<21+20=41>>41
To get free shipping he would need to spend 50-41 = $<<50-41=7>>7 more on books
#### 7

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 9, not 7. This appears to be a minor miscalculation.
